meanings.definition: Vichies (noun): A type of small, crispy biscuit or cookie.
meanings.sent1: I love to snack on vichies during my tea time.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street sells delicious vichies.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone enjoyed the vichies with their coffee.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked vichies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The vichies melted in my mouth, leaving a sweet taste.

meanings.definition: Vichies (verb): To move quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: The kids vichied across the playground to the swings.
meanings.sent2: I had to vichies to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: She vichied through the crowd to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to vichies by as we raced to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel vichied up the tree to escape the dog.

meanings.definition: Vichies (adjective): Describing something that is fashionable or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She wore a vichies dress to the party and turned heads.
meanings.sent2: The new boutique in town sells vichies clothing.
meanings.sent3: His vichies hat matched perfectly with his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The vichies accessories completed her elegant look.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in a vichies style, with modern furniture and bold colors.
